extensionDescription.message: Converts GitHub's relative time format to absolute datetime display

popupHeaderSubtitle.message: Convert relative times to absolute dates

popupEnableDescription.message: Convert GitHub's relative times to absolute dates

popupDebugDescription.message: Show debug messages in browser console

optionsHeaderSubtitle.message: Configure how GitHub's relative times are converted to absolute dates

optionsEnableDesc.message: When enabled, the extension will automatically convert GitHub's relative time elements (like "2 hours ago") to absolute datetime format (like "Dec 15, 2022 at 3:45 PM").

optionsEnableDetails.message: This affects all relative-time elements on GitHub pages including commits, issues, and pull requests.

optionsDebugDesc.message: Enable debug logging to the browser console. Useful for troubleshooting issues or understanding how the extension processes relative time elements.

optionsDebugDetails.message: Debug messages will appear in the browser's developer console (F12 ‚Üí Console tab).

optionsStatusEnabled.message: Extension Active - Converting relative times to absolute dates

optionsStatusDisabled.message: Extension Disabled - Relative times will display as normal

optionsHowItWorksDesc.message: This extension modifies GitHub's relative-time elements to show absolute dates instead of relative ones.

optionsFooterLine2.message: Converts GitHub's relative times to absolute dates for better precision

errorLoadingSettingsOptions.message: Error loading settings - Please refresh the page

showTimeDesc.message: Choose when to include time (hours/minutes) in dates

showWeekdayDesc.message: Control weekday prefix for older items
